pros: There are many benefits of working at SU such as health, salary, etc.
cons: The school has not looked towards the future of what the education landscape is and is not adapting to meet the needs/wishes of new generations coming in with a meaningful and organized approach to services.

pros: Lots of freedom, flexible schedule. I enjoy building relationships with students through mentoring and advising.

pros: Flexibility, Working with Students, Working with nice colleagues

pros: Benefits are good. Union offers more security.
cons: Higher ed notoriously pays on the lower end. The union can seem to hold some people back in terms of wages and taking on more responsibility to increase chances for advancement. Morale is extremely low across campus.

pros: Great benefits, and salary is good for some disciplines. It is a union shop so everyone is on the same pay scale, which means we attract really good people in some disciplines but not so much in others. Collegial atmosphere, and faculty are steadfastly devoted to students' success and well-being.
cons: The last administration (ending in 2020) reorganized constantly causing an enormous churn in administrative and support staff. It feels like a worse place to work in 2021 than it did in 2016, so it seems to be going in the wrong direction. The new interim administration has been left with a lot of big issues to deal with

pros: Benefits are great, generous leave, mostly laid back work environment
cons: Some bad decision making, too much focus on higher education and lack if common sense. Poor management.

review_title: Lots of Work Little Pay or Lots of Pay Little Work
pros: There are some weeks where nothing comes up and all I have to do is talk to people on my floor.
cons: Sometimes, your Residence Director gets on you daily trying to get you to do more not just for your floor but for the building and for the campus as a whole.

pros: True mission for public higher education
cons: Ongoing budget crises are happening.

review_title: The best job I’ve ever had
pros: Teaching these students is rewarding, faculty union is strong, 9 month contracts and opportunities for overloads and summer pay are great. A faculty position is great for work-life balance.
cons: Many faculty are overworked and burnt out. One’s experience really depends on the situations in each department or college.

pros: Tuition waiver for yourself and immediate family, state benefits and retirement, somewhat flexible work schedule.
cons: State pay and minimal raises. I've only received one 1.5% raise in three years of working because my position is non-union. Union faculty and staff receive yearly raises, and they are not rewarded on a merit basis.

job_title: Food Service Worker in Shippensburg, PA
pros: Friendly people to work with
cons: Work short staffed some times

job_title: Office Support Staff in Camp Hill, PA
pros: Good people and a school with a wonderful historical past
cons: Shippensburg University is in decline. Before Covid, the school was experiencing a dramatic enrollment decline which continue continues. The school is currently enduring a tremendous financial crisis. Many talented and valuable people have departed in the last several months, many others have been furloughed--including nearly all adjunct professors--a hiring freeze is in place and, as people leave, their jobs are simply being added to the load already borne by current employees. Morale is at rock bottom. The school is 30 years behind in terms of education: before Covid, Shippensburg University offered no online classes to resident students and offered no credit for any online courses taken. Overall, I would describe this university as the ""K Mart" of collegiate institutions--behind the times, mired in the status quo, and complacent to the degree that institutional failure is only a matter of time.

pros: great staff to work with

pros: Great people and experience ;)
cons: Bad pay and / or compensation

pros: When you do not have a tutoring appointment, you are free to work on school work or watch netflix as long as you are quiet/have headphones. Also as long as you are at the learning center for your shift, you are paid whether you have a student to tutor or not. This is helpful when you have homework to work on or an exam to study for.
cons: The tutoring area is very open so there is little privacy. Such as, if I am tutoring a student that is embarrassed because they need help, it is impossible for me to tutor them in a private room. So any tutor or tutoree in the area can see everyone else in the room/also overhear our tutoring session

pros: University environment is laid back, reasonable hours and work environment.  Decent pay, good benefits.  Very good people, fun to be around the students.  Keeps you young!
cons: Many "lifers" around that have no experience outside the organization can prove to be poor leaders.  Also, being at the whim of state legislators budget preparation makes it feel like you are always living year to year.  Many employees are union and that really slows down progress and impedes change.

review_title: It’s great to be a graduate assistant at Ship!
pros: I have been working at Shippensburg University as a Graduate Assistant for about 7 months. I have a great relationship with the faculty members and students. As a GA, I was granted with tuition waiver which will allow me to complete my Masters program with no debts.
cons: Even though the tuition waiver is granted to Graduate Assistants, the waiver does not cover the university fees. So GA’s still have to pay for those fees.

review_title: Great Environment, Low Pay, Watch for the *FEES*
pros: Great environment as you are pursuing your graduate degree because it facilitates an academic environment, while also providing you with tuition fee waiver and a salary
cons:
Low salary 
FEES of about $1,500 for 9 credits

review_title: I loved being a tutor for Shippensburg University when I was a student there.
pros: As a student I was able to take off when I had a heavy work load. Very nice and understandable.
cons: Really no cons besides the pay but I was thankful to have a job there!

pros: Shippensburg University was an excellent place to work. I was able to perform to the best of my ability due to tremendous support from my supervisors.
